verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD; For three transgressions of Moab, and for four, I will not turn away the punishment thereof; because he burned the bones of the king of Edom into lime:
verses.ct: This is what the LORD says: "Because of the repeated sins of Moab — offense after offense — I will not hold back their punishment, because they burned the bones of Edom's king until they turned to powder."

verses.kjv: But I will send a fire upon Moab, and it shall devour the palaces of Kirioth: and Moab shall die with tumult, with shouting, and with the sound of the trumpet:
verses.ct: "So I will unleash fire on Moab, and it will consume the fortresses of Kirioth. Moab will perish in chaos, amid war cries and the blast of the trumpet."

verses.kjv: And I will cut off the judge from the midst thereof, and will slay all the princes thereof with him, saith the LORD.
verses.ct: "I will eliminate their ruler from among them and kill all their officials along with him," says the LORD.

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD; For three transgressions of Judah, and for four, I will not turn away the punishment thereof; because they have despised the law of the LORD, and have not kept his commandments, and their lies caused them to err, after the which their fathers have walked:
verses.ct: This is what the LORD says: "Because of the repeated sins of Judah — offense after offense — I will not hold back their punishment, because they rejected the instructions of the LORD and refused to follow his commands. The same false gods that led their ancestors astray led them into error as well."

verses.kjv: But I will send a fire upon Judah, and it shall devour the palaces of Jerusalem.
verses.ct: "So I will unleash fire on Judah, and it will consume the fortresses of Jerusalem."

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD; For three transgressions of Israel, and for four, I will not turn away the punishment thereof; because they sold the righteous for silver, and the poor for a pair of shoes;
verses.ct: This is what the LORD says: "Because of the repeated sins of Israel — offense after offense — I will not hold back their punishment, because they sold innocent people for silver and the needy for a pair of sandals."

verses.kjv: That pant after the dust of the earth on the head of the poor, and turn aside the way of the meek: and a man and his father will go in unto the same maid, to profane my holy name:
verses.ct: "They trample the heads of the helpless into the dirt and deny justice to the oppressed. A father and his son both have relations with the same young woman, disgracing my holy name."

verses.kjv: And they lay themselves down upon clothes laid to pledge by every altar, and they drink the wine of the condemned in the house of their god.
verses.ct: "They stretch out beside every altar on garments taken as collateral from the poor, and in the temple of their god they drink wine bought with fines they extorted."

verses.kjv: Yet destroyed I the Amorite before them, whose height was like the height of the cedars, and he was strong as the oaks; yet I destroyed his fruit from above, and his roots from beneath.
verses.ct: "Yet I was the one who destroyed the Amorites ahead of them — people as tall as cedar trees and as strong as oaks. I destroyed them completely, from their branches above to their roots below."

verses.kjv: Also I brought you up from the land of Egypt, and led you forty years through the wilderness, to possess the land of the Amorite.
verses.ct: "I was the one who brought you out of Egypt and guided you through the wilderness for 40 years so you could take over the land of the Amorites."

verses.kjv: And I raised up of your sons for prophets, and of your young men for Nazarites. Is it not even thus, O ye children of Israel? saith the LORD.
verses.ct: "I appointed some of your sons as prophets and some of your young men as Nazirites. Isn't this true, people of Israel?" declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: But ye gave the Nazarites wine to drink; and commanded the prophets, saying, Prophesy not.
verses.ct: "But you pressured the Nazirites to drink wine, and you ordered the prophets, 'Stop prophesying!'"

verses.kjv: Behold, I am pressed under you, as a cart is pressed that is full of sheaves.
verses.ct: "Look, I am weighed down beneath you, like a cart groaning under a full load of grain."

verses.kjv: Therefore the flight shall perish from the swift, and the strong shall not strengthen his force, neither shall the mighty deliver himself:
verses.ct: "When that time comes, even the fastest runners won't be able to escape. The strong will lose their strength, and warriors won't be able to save themselves."

verses.kjv: Neither shall he stand that handleth the bow; and he that is swift of foot shall not deliver himself: neither shall he that rideth the horse deliver himself.
verses.ct: "Archers won't be able to hold their ground. The quickest sprinters won't outrun danger, and horsemen won't be able to save themselves either."

verses.kjv: And he that is courageous among the mighty shall flee away naked in that day, saith the LORD.
verses.ct: "Even the bravest warriors will throw down their weapons and run away naked on that day," declares the LORD.
